justification: “A commonly used tool for measuring online changes in workload is the Detection Response Task (DRT, ISO:17488, 2016)… the DRT serves as a continuous measurement tool where the latency of responses and propensity to miss stimulus provide … a sensitive (and well validated) measure of attention.”
The authors state that the DRT “indexes residual cognitive resources,” indicating the task is used to measure the amount of attention a person still has available.
The paper notes that “The MOT task is a widely used paradigm… Workload is manipulated by increasing the number of dots to track,” showing MOT is the instrument for assessing cognitive load.
For the MOT, the authors “fit standard decision-making models … Signal Detection Theory Model to the MOT,” using SDT parameters (d′, β) to quantify discrimination ability.

topic_or_construct: evidence accumulation speed in detection responses
justification: The Detection Response Task data were “modelled as a single Wald accumulator for response time and accuracy,” so the Wald model parameters (e.g., drift rate v) operationalise evidence-accumulation speed.
